causing or involving synergy (= the combined power of working together that is greater than the power achieved by working separately): the synergistic effect of two drugs given at the same time See
synergy
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a synergistic effect when agencies work together. It is a combination that creates a synergistic benefit beyond that of either project standing alone.The scientists found that this treatment, when combined with chemotherapy, was synergistic in halting cell growth. I don't agree with nutritional supplements - the body needs the synergistic ratio of organic nutrients found in whole foods.
